title: Coordinate Plane Explorer
description: An interactive MicroSim that helps students understand the coordinate plane structure, including quadrants, axes, origin, and point location through hands-on exploration and quiz mode.
subject: Mathematics
prerequisites: Understanding of positive and negative numbers
Ability to read and write ordered pairs
learningObjectives: Identify and label the x-axis, y-axis, and origin on a coordinate plane
Understand the structure and numbering of the four quadrants
Plot points accurately using ordered pairs (x, y)
Determine which quadrant contains a given point
Recognize the sign patterns for coordinates in each quadrant
Use coordinates to describe the location of points on a plane
educationalStandards: CCSS.MATH.CONTENT.6.NS.C.6 - Understand rational numbers as points on the number line and in the coordinate plane
CCSS.MATH.CONTENT.6.NS.C.8 - Solve problems by graphing points in all four quadrants
CCSS.MATH.CONTENT.6.G.A.3 - Draw polygons in the coordinate plane
author: MicroSim Development Team

controls.label: Point
controls.description: Drag the red point anywhere on the coordinate plane to explore different coordinate positions

controls.label: Enter x
controls.description: Input field to enter the x-coordinate directly

controls.label: Enter y
controls.description: Input field to enter the y-coordinate directly

controls.label: Plot
controls.description: Plot the point at the coordinates entered in the input fields

controls.label: Random Point
controls.description: Generate and plot a random point on the coordinate plane

controls.label: Quiz Mode
controls.description: Toggle quiz mode where students are challenged to plot given coordinates

controls.label: Check Answer
controls.description: Check if the plotted point matches the quiz target (only visible in quiz mode)

controls.label: Quadrant Shading
controls.description: Toggle color-coded shading of the four quadrants

controls.label: Grid Lines
controls.description: Toggle visibility of grid lines for easier point placement

controls.label: Reference Lines
controls.description: Toggle dotted lines from the point to both axes

visualElements: Coordinate grid from -10 to 10 on both axes
Origin marked with dot and (0, 0) label
Quadrant labels (I, II, III, IV) in Roman numerals
Color-coded quadrant shading (I: light blue, II: light green, III: light yellow, IV: light pink)
Draggable red point with shadow effect
Dotted reference lines from point to axes
Real-time coordinate display with color coding
interactiveFeatures: Drag point to any location on the plane
Smooth animations when plotting new points
Direct coordinate entry via input fields
assessmentOpportunities: Quiz mode tracks correct vs. total attempts
Immediate feedback on coordinate plotting accuracy
Hints provided when answers are incorrect (which coordinate needs adjustment)
Exit ticket: Successfully plot 3 points in quiz mode

accessibility.screenReader: Includes describe() function for screen reader support
accessibility.colorBlindSafe: Uses high contrast colors and multiple visual cues beyond color

commonMisconceptions.remedy: Color-coded display always shows x first; mnemonic 'x before y in alphabet'
Quadrant shading visually shows negative regions; incremental practice

commonMisconceptions.misconception: Points on axes belong to quadrants
commonMisconceptions.remedy: Clear 'On x-axis' or 'On y-axis' messages; discussion of quadrant definitions

extensionActivities: Plot points to create geometric shapes

technologyRequirements.devices: Desktop, laptop, tablet (700px width minimum recommended)

cognitiveLoadConsiderations.intrinsic: Coordinate system with four quadrants and signed numbers
cognitiveLoadConsiderations.extraneous: Minimized through clean interface and optional visual aids
cognitiveLoadConsiderations.germane: Focused on coordinate relationships and spatial reasoning

differentiationStrategies: Quadrant shading can be toggled for visual learners
Grid lines assist students who need more structure
Reference lines show explicit connections to axes
Quiz mode provides practice with immediate feedback
Random point generator offers unlimited practice opportunities
